A discourse of the plague containing the nature, causes, signs, and presages of the pestilence in general, together with the state of the present contagion : also most rational preservatives for families, and choice curative medicines both for rich and poor, with several waies for purifying the air in houses, streets, etc. / published for the benefit of this great city of London, and suburbs by Gideon Harvey. Harvey, Gideon, 1640?-1700?
[2], 29 p.
Printed for Nath. Brooke, London : 1665.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
